basics.name: Aveen Hussein
basics.label: Software Engineering & AI Research
basics.summary: Master's candidate in System and Applied Software Engineering at ITMO University. Research focus on industrial automation, computer vision, and autonomous systems. Experienced in machine learning, simulation development, and software engineering.

work.name: Women in Tech Program
work.summary: Teaching Python programming fundamentals to women entering tech careers and providing guidance on software development best practices.
highlights: Teaching Python programming fundamentals to women entering tech careers
Providing guidance on software development best practices and career development
Supporting participants in building practical programming projects
Helping bridge the gender gap in technology through education and mentorship

education.institution: Higher Institute of Applied Sciences and Technology

publications.name: Augmentation of Laser Welding Dataset through a Combination of Evolutionary Optimization and Deep Learning
publications.summary: Solovev, G.V., Nikitin, N.O., Sokolov, M.S., & Hussein, A. - Conference Proceedings

publications.name: Defect Detection in Laser Welds: A Segmentation and Data Augmentation Framework for Automated Quality Control
publications.summary: Hussein, A., Sokolov, M., & Solovev, G. - Under Review

publications.name: Intelligent Weld Inspection: Machine Learning-driven Defect Detection for Automated Laser Welding Quality Control
publications.summary: Hussein, A., Sokolov, M., & Solovev, G. - Abstract Presentation

projects.name: Intelligent Weld Inspection System
projects.description: Machine Learning-driven Defect Detection for Automated Laser Welding Quality Control
highlights: Developed automated weld defect detection pipeline using YOLOv8 segmentation achieving 97.5% accuracy
Augmented dataset using Stable Diffusion and deep learning models, generating 4,537 synthetic weld images for rare defects
Implemented real-time monitoring and control system for laser welding quality inspection
Applied OpenCV edge detection and OCR techniques for multi-modal data analysis

projects.name: Autonomous Vehicle Simulation
projects.description: Self-driving car in simulated environment using deep reinforcement learning
highlights: Led research coordination with 6 researchers across CV, Graphics, AI, and Systems Engineering
Implemented custom physics system in Unity simulating six distinct forces, LiDAR sensor, and cameras
Created dynamic traffic system using waypoint and pooling for 30 vehicles and 30 pedestrians
Compared DQN and DDQN control methods, achieving 30 km/h average speed using DQN

projects.name: Urban Planning Traffic Simulation
projects.description: Gamification of Urban Planning for Traffic Simulation and Prediction
highlights: Developing traffic system for large-scale online city building simulator using Godot Engine
Integrating system into 'world dynamic' project for future scalability
Working on traffic prediction algorithms for urban planning applications
Collaborating with COSM Lab research team on simulation development
